title: Upper-Intermediate English 407
headline: Learn how to use indirect speech in this free online English course that provides vocabulary related to mass media.
description: This English course provides basic vocabulary related to mass media, used to discuss current events. We revise how to use direct speech before explaining how to change it into indirect speech using various verbs, adverbs, and question words. We supply audio and written exercises to help you practice your new skills as you learn to write and structure stories in the form of news reports. Learn and develop your English with this progressive course!
courseDescription:
This English course introduces you to some basic vocabulary related to mass media, allowing you to report on what's happening in the news. We provide opportunities to read, listen to, and repeat these new words and phrases, helping you improve your English pronunciation. We also include a reading activity that shows you how to use your new vocabulary in the context of mass media and current events.

The grammar section of this course reviews the use of direct speech and reminds you of the three formats in which you may write them. We then introduce you to the use and application of indirect speech and the rules governing its structure. We explain how to change direct speech into indirect speech using various verbs, adverbs, modals, and 'wh-' words.

The exercises in the 'Student Practice' section are designed to help you revise your reading, listening, and speaking skills while drawing on the knowledge you have gained from all topics in this course. The downloadable writing task, found in this course's 'Resources' section, will allow you to write and structure three paragraphs of text into a short news article. Sign up to learn how to use indirect speech and impress your friends with your newfound ability to discuss the news in English.
